intro: Pseudoselago prolixa, commonly known as the long-stemmed pseudoselago, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a slightly hairy surface. Pseudoselago prolixa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
